p: We further identify surfaces of small objects such as elevator buttons ( Figure 2 d), which are touched at intervals of >10 s by many individuals, as a suitable target for UV-C protection. They would require a UV-C intensity <1 W/m 2 to accumulate a fluence F 0 ∼ 10 J/m 2 between uses necessary to achieve 90% disinfection (see above). Thus, a typical element with a surface area of ∼0.01 m 2 could be continuously disinfected using just a marginal <10 mW UV-C power, aimed at it, for example, from a small light-emitting diode (LED).
